name: Lentil and Green Collard Soup
author: cook
summary: This is a purely Lebanese recipe, which can be eaten cold in summer or hot in winter. Make sure you find the right Lentil type! It's healthy and yummy!
ingredients: 1 cup dry red lentils, rinsed and drained
1 bunch collard greens - rinsed, stemmed and thinly sliced
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, stir in onion and salt; cook until softened and translucent, about 4 minutes
Stir in lentils, and cook for 1 minute
Pour in water, then bring to a boil over high heat, then turn heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the lentils are tender, about 15 minutes
Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add  , and cook until wilted, about 10 minutes
When the lentils are tender, stir in the collard greens and season with cumin, cinnamon, and garlic; allow to simmer 10 more minutes
Stir in lemon juice before serving
